column1: I think that this class can often get really bogged down in the R, but I wish there could be more in the way of statistical theory. Is there perhaps, a glossary of some of the terms that are used?
very confused by the dummy coding

Does it ever actually make sense to run anovas? Versus to hand-code constrasts on categorical variables (however makes sense, sometimes helmert, sometimes contrast coding, etc) so that the summary output is interpretable?

Today was a lot of information. Was it mostly for us to understand the behind the scenes bits? I'm a little unclear on the application part of it, and how to use the different things we looked at to answer specific questions about the data.
